titles.title: Equality in Education Act of 1987

A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to deny tax exempt status to educational institutions which have been found to have a policy of racial discrimination against any group in enrollment, hiring, or in other areas, until such institutions clearly and convincingly demonstrate their abandonment of such policy through the enrollment, hiring, or the taking of other vigorous, affirmative, and continued corrective action with respect to such group.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 4/1/1987--Introduced. Equality in Education Act of 1987 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to deny tax-exempt status to any educational institution which has been found to have a policy of racial discrimination against any group in enrollment, hiring, or in other areas until such institution clearly and convincingly demonstrates abandonment of such policy through enrollment, hiring, or the taking of other vigorous, affirmative, and continued corrective action with respect to such group.
